Description: Light green base fragment of small vessel, possibly a flask, goblet or beaker, folded base ring.
Production place: Made in: Egypt (raw glass imported from Levantine area?)
Curator's comments: Chemical analysis (by electon probe micro-analysis (EPMA)) showed that this glass has slightly elevated levels of antimony and manganese and is compositionally close to the so-called Roman blue/green glass, a relatively uncommon raw glass group in Roman Egypt. The raw glass itself might thus be an import from the Levantine area. However, this does not exclude that the vessel was worked in Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FE.09)
